feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Possible Over Eastern North Slope Monday Night and Tuesday... Between 2 and 4 inches of snow accumulation is possible between Monday night and Tuesday from the Dalton Highway east. The heaviest amounts are expected east of the Dalton Highway.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Possible Across Eastern Interior Monday Into Tuesday... A mix of rain and snow is expected across the Eastern Interior from Monday into Tuesday. At valley level, such as in Fairbanks, snow should melt as it hits the ground. At elevations above 2000 feet, between 2 and 4 inches of snow accumulation is possible between Monday and Tuesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

cap:geocode.value: AKZ218 AKZ220 AKZ221 AKZ222 AKZ223 AKZ224 AKZ225 AKZ226

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:28PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Sunday... North winds 20 to 30 mph are blowing from the Bering Strait to St Lawrence Island and will continue into Sunday. This will cause elevated surf and beach erosion along north facing shores in the Bering Strait and at St Lawrence Island through Sunday. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
